title: Shot fired at window of family home as 'terrified' woman and children were inside - Manchester Evening News
text:
News Shot fired at window of family home as 'terrified' woman and children were inside The single shot was fired at a house on Longdale Drive, in Hattersley, in the early hours of Saturday morning. A gunman opened fire on a house in the early hours as a 'terrified' woman and children were inside. 
A black Mercedes was seen leaving the scene at speed. Police believe it was a targeted attack. 
The single shot was fired at a house on Longdale Drive, in Hattersley, Tameside, in the early hours of Saturday morning. 
Nobody was hurt during the attack, which happened at around 3.10am. Read More 
Police found damage to an upstairs window consistent with gunshot damage. 
Detectives have now stepped up patrols in the area. 
Dc Marc Barker has appealed for any witnesses or anyone with information to get in touch. Read More Arsonist who torched flats and car parks in Spice-fuelled rampage says 'I wanted to get nicked' 
He added: “It is fortunate that no one was hurt, but a woman and children were at home at the time and were, understandably, terrified. 
“We believe this was a targeted attack and I want to reassure the community that a team of officers is working on this case and we have increased patrols in the area.” 
Anyone with any information should contact police on 0161 856 9309 or 101 quoting incident numbers 353 of 18/02/17 or anonymously via the independent charity Crimestoppers on 0800 555 111. Like us on Facebook
